text: by April 24, 2025Source: YouTube "True story, I swear." Netflix has revealed an official trailer for Bad Boy, an Israeli series from the original creators of the Israeli version of "Euphoria". This series originally premiered in 2023 at the Toronto Film Festival, and was picked up by Netflix there. It's now set for a streaming debut worldwide on Netflix this May. From Ron Leshem, creator of the original Israeli "Euphoria" from 2012 (which was remade in the HBO version), comes Bad Boy, the award-winning new series about youth, survival, and redemption. Inspired by true events, the series follows Dean, a teen imprisoned in juvenile detention who discovers the power of creativity to heal. Starring Daniel Chen, Havtamo Farda, Neta Plotnik, and Guy Manster as Dean. This dynamic drama tells the story of a troubled teen who is sent away to a brutal juvenile detention facility, and how his humor and wit keep him alive. Doesn't sound like the most uplifting series to watch right now. But this trailer hints at how creative and unique this series is – reminds me of City of God in several ways. Here's the new official trailer (+ poster) for Hagar Ben-Asher's series Bad Boy, direct from YouTube: Bad Boy tells the powerful story of Dean Scheinman (starring Guy Manster), a teenager imprisoned in a juvenile detention facility. Offering a gripping exploration of youth, redemption, brotherhood, friendship, the series follows Dean’s narrative from imprisonment to discovering his unique creative ability to heal deep wounds. Bad Boy is a series co-created and co-written by showrunner Ron Leshem (of the original "Euphoria" aka "HOT", and also "No Man's Land", "Valley of Tears", "Traitor", "Red Skies") and filmmaker Hagar Ben Asher (of Long Bright River and The Slut). With writing by Daniel Amsel, Daniel Chen, Amit Cohen, Roee Florentin, Moshe Malka, Adi Samarias, Guy Zach. All of the episodes are directed by filmmaker Hagar Ben-Asher. Executive produced by Tmira Yardeni, Ron Leshem, Hagar Ben Asher, Daniel Chen, Mirit Toovi, Guy Levy, Ori Gal, Emilio Schenker, Michael Peter Schmidt, Gideon Tadmor, Jan David Frouman, Amy Israel, Kristin Jones Hill. This initially premiered at the 2023 Toronto Film Festival last year. Netflix will debut this Bad Boy series streaming on Netflix worldwide starting on May 2nd, 2025. Look any good? Source: YouTube

"True story, I swear." Netflix has revealed an official trailer for Bad Boy, an Israeli series from the original creators of the Israeli version of "Euphoria". This series originally premiered in 2023 at the Toronto Film Festival, and was picked up by Netflix there. It's now set for a streaming debut worldwide on Netflix this May. From Ron Leshem, creator of the original Israeli "Euphoria" from 2012 (which was remade in the HBO version), comes Bad Boy, the award-winning new series about youth, survival, and redemption. Inspired by true events, the series follows Dean, a teen imprisoned in juvenile detention who discovers the power of creativity to heal. Starring Daniel Chen, Havtamo Farda, Neta Plotnik, and Guy Manster as Dean. This dynamic drama tells the story of a troubled teen who is sent away to a brutal juvenile detention facility, and how his humor and wit keep him alive. Doesn't sound like the most uplifting series to watch right now. But this trailer hints at how creative and unique this series is – reminds me of City of God in several ways.

Here's the new official trailer (+ poster) for Hagar Ben-Asher's series Bad Boy, direct from YouTube:

Bad Boy tells the powerful story of Dean Scheinman (starring Guy Manster), a teenager imprisoned in a juvenile detention facility. Offering a gripping exploration of youth, redemption, brotherhood, friendship, the series follows Dean’s narrative from imprisonment to discovering his unique creative ability to heal deep wounds. Bad Boy is a series co-created and co-written by showrunner Ron Leshem (of the original "Euphoria" aka "HOT", and also "No Man's Land", "Valley of Tears", "Traitor", "Red Skies") and filmmaker Hagar Ben Asher (of Long Bright River and The Slut). With writing by Daniel Amsel, Daniel Chen, Amit Cohen, Roee Florentin, Moshe Malka, Adi Samarias, Guy Zach. All of the episodes are directed by filmmaker Hagar Ben-Asher. Executive produced by Tmira Yardeni, Ron Leshem, Hagar Ben Asher, Daniel Chen, Mirit Toovi, Guy Levy, Ori Gal, Emilio Schenker, Michael Peter Schmidt, Gideon Tadmor, Jan David Frouman, Amy Israel, Kristin Jones Hill. This initially premiered at the 2023 Toronto Film Festival last year. Netflix will debut this Bad Boy series streaming on Netflix worldwide starting on May 2nd, 2025. Look any good?
